moodish.server

Interface MoodishServer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MoodishServerDummy, ServerMain

    public interface MoodishServer
    A Moodish server should use a ServerComm interface to communicate with clients. The server is responsible for:
    • maintaining information about who is friend of whom
    • for relaying Moodish messages appropriately
    • for updating clients with information regarding who is currently online
    • for updating clients on friends

    When a client connects, the server send one CONNECTED message (ServerComm.sendClientConnected()) for each connected client so that the newly connected client can maintain a list of clients currently connected to the server.

    When a client disconnects, all clients should be sent a DISCONNECTED message (ServerComm.sendClientDisconnected()). When a client disconnects, it loses all its friends and automatically unfreinds all other clients. The server should thus not maintain a memory server regarding friends of disconnected clients.

    The server should use ServerComm.getNextMessage() to receive:

    • Moodish messages to be relayed (type = MOODISH_MESSAGE),
    • notifications about new friendship request (type = FRIENDSHIP)
    • notifications about new unfriendship request (type = UNFRIENDSHIP)
    • notifications about a new client connection (type = CONNECTED)
    • notifications about clients who go offline (type = DISCONNECTED)
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    alc

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void start(ServerComm serverComm)
      Starts the server and only returns when (if ever) the server is stopped.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(ServerComm serverComm)
        Starts the server and only returns when (if ever) the server is stopped.
        Parameters:
        serverComm - the serverComm through which the server should communicate with clients.
